com.amazon.device.messaging

Class ADM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.device.messaging.ADM

  • public class ADM
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the core methods to support registering an app instance to use Amazon Device Messaging (ADM).

    Note: Although ADM methods are thread-safe, they are not process safe. You should avoid using ADM from different processes of the same app simultaneously.

    Since:
    {public class com.amazon.device.messaging.ADM {}

    • Constructor Detail

      • ADM

        public ADM(android.content.Context context)
        The entry point to ADM. You may create more than one ADM object and use each on any thread.
        Parameters:
        context - The context for which to create an ADM object.
        Since:
        {public com.amazon.device.messaging.ADM(android.content.Context);}

    • Method Detail

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported()
        Indicates whether ADM is supported on the current device.
        Returns:
        true if ADM is present.
        Since:
        {public boolean isSupported();}

      • startRegister

        public void startRegister()
        Starts an asynchronous operation that registers your app for receiving ADM messages. Your ADMMessageHandlerBase receives a ADMMessageHandlerBase.onRegistered(String) callback when startRegister() completes or an ADMMessageHandlerBase.onRegistrationError(String) callback if it fails.

        Registration will fail unless an amazon user is signed in to the device.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if ADM is not supported on the device.
        Since:
        {public void startRegister();}

      • startUnregister

        public void startUnregister()
        Starts an asynchronous operation that unregisters your app from receiving ADM messages. Your ADMMessageHandlerBase receives an ADMMessageHandlerBase.onUnregistered(String) callback when startUnregister completes or an ADMMessageHandlerBase.onRegistrationError(String) callback if it fails.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if ADM is not supported on the device.
        Since:
        {public void startUnregister();}

      • getRegistrationId

        public java.lang.String getRegistrationId()
        Obtains the current registration ID for this instance of your app. Registration Ids have a maximum size of 1536 characters.
        Returns:
        The current registration ID for this app instance or null if the current instance is not registered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if ADM is not supported on the device.
        Since:
        {public java.lang.String getRegistrationId();}
